item.title: KiNo Fundraiser Campaign with Kickstarter
item.description:
Dear friends,

I have just launched a Kickstarter Campaign hoping to fund the next step in my musical life. I would like to record a series of singles and tour in order to maximise my output which has always been hindered by the bermuda triangle of production + time + dependencies on people minus the backing of a label.

Therefore, my producer Jeff Blenkinsopp is inventing a new machine for me.

Basically, it's the suitcase version of the gigantic KiNo Live Rig. This machine would enable me to prepare songs as I write them for both live performance and recording, without relying on anyone, anywhere. This is a serious tool and a dream.

People who know me, know this well that I am an extremely prolific musician; I have written over 500 songs and the frusturation of not being able to share them with people has always been a bit of a curse.

So, finally, for this campaign I have come up with some rewards for your help and support. Hope this finds you well. Will you consider sharing this with your mates?

With this link you can directly bet on the winning on horse :)
kck.st/HKxBTO
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: KiNo Fundraiser — Kickstarter

item.title: LIVE! — Part 5: Istanbul
item.description:
Poet of Sound and Image KiNo goes to Istanbul to make his first short film with a bunch of eclectic participants:

Starring: Jane Birkin, Ilhan Ersahin, Ugur Yucel, Mustafa Bilgin, Sebnem Donmez, Izzet Uzunhasanoglu, Sinem Yilmaz, Kuzey Yilmaz, Nils Petter Molvaer, Safak Atahan, Selen Cambazoglu, Arto Tuncboyaciyan, Yasar Kurt, Selin Akinci, Yusuf Sayman, Askin Karaduman, Melisa Roman, Ozan Ilhan…

item.itunes:subtitle: Poet of sound and image goes to Istanbul

item.title: LIVE! — Part 4: Occupied with War Street
item.description:
This is my account of what Occupy Wall Street movement is stirring.
Would love to hear your comments.
Justice is always poetic, or not justice at all.

“Poet of Sound and Image KiNo dedicates this episode of Live! to courageous people who take action against the rotten institutions of political and financial piss-taking.

There are only two possibilities to a change:
1. Pulling the carpet slowly
2. Pulling the carpet fast”
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: This is my account of what Occupy Wall Street movement is stirring.
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: LIVE! — Part 3
item.description:
Poet of Sound and Image KiNo presents a film in episodes: Live!
Documentary of life and collaborations in New Vague City.

This film is dedicated to my friend Ira Cohen who passed away recently; leaving behind a materialised account of the akashic records in his poems, photographs, films and inspiring conversations with the individuals whom were graced by his friendship.

With highlights from the KiNo Exhibition — Invasion from Within.
Featuring footage of the performances with musical legends Malcolm Cecil (Pioneer of electronic music) and Andy Rourke (The Smiths).
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: LIVE! — Part 3
item.itunes:summary:

With highlights from the KiNo Exhibition — Invasion from Within. Featuring footage of the performances with musical legends Malcolm Cecil (Pioneer of electronic music) and Andy Rourke (The Smiths).

item.title: Invasion From Within — Trailer 1 (Malcolm Cecil, Tonto & KiNo)
item.description:
Video Trailer 1 for the upcoming KiNo Exhibition at the World Monuments Fund Gallery — OPENING NIGHT on June 3rd. The Exhibition runs throughout the month with daily live performances by KiNo and 9 different sets of music.

For full schedule of live performances:
poetofsoundandimage.com/​june

9 special sets of KiNo's original music and sonic pieces will be performed throughout the month, combining the forces of the KiNo Live Rig* and TONTO.

A treasured special-guest lineup includes the following artists:

Malcolm Cecil ("Godfather of electronic music")
Andy Rourke (The Smiths)
Joe McGinty (Psychedelic Furs)
Juini Booth (McCoy Tyner/Sun Ra)
Jesper Kyd (composer: Hitman, Assassin's Creed)
DJ Jonathan Peters
Ilhan Ersahin (Wax Poetic)
Jonathan Haffner (Bill Friser)

The gallery landscape will be punctuated by two-dimensional works from artists Bill Alpert, Bartus Bartolomes, Scott Alger, Astolfo Funes and Marjan Denkov.

Curated by Belen Bosch & Ana Rita Da Piadade.
KiNo Live is produced by the Sonic Wizard Jeff Blenkinsopp.
Exhibition Production by Ana Rita Da Piadade, Jeff Blenkinsopp & KiNo
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: KiNo Exhibition - Invasion From Within — Malcolm Cecil, Tonto & KiNo
item.itunes:summary:
Video Trailer 1 for the upcoming KiNo Exhibition at the World Monuments Fund Gallery — OPENING NIGHT on June 3rd. The Exhibition runs throughout the month with daily live performances by KiNo and 9 different sets of music.
For full schedule of live performances: poetofsoundandimage.com/​june
9 special sets of KiNo's original music and sonic pieces will be performed throughout the month, combining the forces of the KiNo Live Rig* and TONTO.
A treasured special-guest lineup includes the following artists:
Malcolm Cecil ("Godfather of electronic music") Andy Rourke (The Smiths) Joe McGinty (Psychedelic Furs) Juini Booth (McCoy Tyner/Sun Ra) Jesper Kyd (composer: Hitman, Assassin's Creed) DJ Jonathan Peters Ilhan Ersahin (Wax Poetic) Jonathan Haffner (Bill Friser)
The gallery landscape will be punctuated by two-dimensional works from artists Bill Alpert, Bartus Bartolomes, Scott Alger, Astolfo Funes and Marjan Denkov.
Curated by Belen Bosch & Ana Rita Da Piadade. KiNo Live is produced by the Sonic Wizard Jeff Blenkinsopp. Exhibition Production by Ana Rita Da Piadade, Jeff Blenkinsopp & KiNo

item.title: LIVE! — Part 2
item.description:
Logic of this life is the logic of a poem.
Featuring excerpts from an interview with KiNo and his classic answer to the most commonly asked question.
The Poet of Sound and Image KiNo presents a film in episodes: Live!

item.title: Neon - Ash (Music Video by KiNo)
item.description: Music video for the 2010 Ash single Neon. An experiment with still image and your habits of viewing motion, progression and duration. Special thanks to Tim Wheeler as the instigator of this project and to Jennifer Armstrong as the tireless KiNo collaborator.
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: Music video for the 2010 Ash single Neon, shot and assembled by KiNo.

item.title: KiNo Live Analogue Rig Completed
item.description:
After 9 months of development the KiNo Live Rig has been completed and installed in its flight case for the upcoming riots.
To see more instances from the production phase click here.

item.title: Summer of Invention
item.description: A photo story about the developments on the KiNo front. You can hear the unearthly sounds we started to make. Sonic wizard Jeff Blenkinsopp and guitarist Alan McSeveney have been collaborating on the software/hardware system that is going to create the sound of Kino Live for the upcoming psychedelic experience.
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: A photo story about the developments on the KiNo front
item.itunes:summary: A photo story about the developments on the KiNo front. You can hear the unearthly sounds we started to make. Sonic wizard Jeff Blenkinsopp and guitarist Alan McSeveney have been collaborating on the software/hardware system that is going to create the sound of Kino Live for the upcoming psychedelic experience.
item.itunes:keywords: Kino, poet of sound and image, psychedelic rock, pink floyd, engineer, live, alan mcseveney, jeff blenkinsopp, analog, filter box

item.title: Up and Running
item.description: KiNo Live is being developed in New York City. One of a kind all custom analogue equipment has been invented by Jeff Blenkinsopp is fully controllable by computer software created by Alan McSeveney who also plays guitars for KiNo. In the band, Justin D. Scott is on keyboards and the legendary drummer Kenny Wollesen is expected to be in the band when musical rehearsals begin towards the end of the august.
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: KiNo Live is being developed in New York City by sonic wizard Jeff Blenkinsopp.

item.title: Selenity [Acoustic Home Recording]
item.description:
Here you can a taste of an intimate moment with KiNo on acoustic guitar, recorded at home around 4 in the morning.
The song is called Selenity.
item.itunes:author: KiNo
item.itunes:subtitle: A home recording in intimate acoustics.

item.title: Won't Do - Remix by We.R.D.2
item.description:
WON'T DO remixed by WE.R.D.2

Ladies and gents, Jonny Craig, one of the maddest drummer in the rock world, a Spacehog, teamed up with his sidekick Christian Langdon to bring you the first remix made of my work as We.R.D.2.
The boys are already commissioned to create 2 more tracks from the album for upcoming 12" record called the MAP OF THE UNIVERSE X.
You, as a podcasters, are entitled to this single.

Download the track here
